title: Research and Analysis Vocabulary
description: Terminology for empirical research and data analysis

items.definition: The ability to produce a desired or intended result
items.example: The study examined the efficacy of the new treatment protocol.

items.definition: To cause confusion or fail to distinguish between variables
items.example: Socioeconomic factors may confound the relationship between diet and health.

items.definition: To extend the application of data or conclusions to an unknown situation
items.example: It would be unwise to extrapolate these findings to the general population.

items.definition: Capable of being reproduced or repeated with the same results
items.example: Scientific findings must be replicable to be considered valid.

items.definition: To arrange or divide into different levels or categories
items.example: Researchers stratified the sample by age and gender.

items.definition: Involving the study of subjects over an extended period of time
items.example: A longitudinal study tracked participants for twenty years.

items.definition: To make less severe, serious, or painful
items.example: Proper controls can mitigate the effects of bias.

items.definition: A variable used to represent or measure another variable indirectly
items.example: GDP is often used as a proxy for national well-being.
